thread.title: Former Panthers player Chris Hill named Milwaukee assistant
thread.title_full: Former Panthers player Chris Hill named Milwaukee assistant

title: Former Panthers player Chris Hill named Milwaukee assistant
text:
UW-Milwaukee names Chris Hill assistant coach, Allan Hanson director of basketball operations THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   7:13   7:13   
Subjects: 

MILWAUKEE — Former UW-Milwaukee basketball player Chris Hill has been named a Panthers assistant coach. 
Hill spent last season as director of basketball operations on coach Rob Jeter's staff. Jeter announced the move Wednesday. 
Jeter also announced that Allan Hanson will become director of basketball operations. Hanson spent last season as the team's video coordinator. 
Before returning to Milwaukee, Hill worked as a graduate assistant at the University of Tennessee after playing basketball overseas. He also previously served as the Panthers' video coordinator and the team's academic adviser. 
Hill played in 116 games during his career at Milwaukee from 2001-06. As the starting point guard on Milwaukee's NCAA Sweet 16 season in 2004-05, he started in 24 games and averaged career bests of 7.8 points, 3.0 rebounds and 3.2 assists per game.
